name: Duque Hotel Boutique & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved it! Great location (close to everything), lovely staffs, incredible service, well price and great internet speed!
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wished we had booked here for the other nights we were in Buenos Aires.
reviews.title: A pleasant change and worth the price!

reviews.text: From the moment you walk in, you are made to feel welcome at this wonderful hotel. The multi-lingual staff welcome you into their home and make life easy. Lovely set out rooms with awesome showers await you when you check in.
reviews.title: Really nice little hotel in a trendy area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The addition of the spa in the basement was a delight, the water was so hot and relaxing, not to forget the Scottish shower as well. Once you work that bad boy out, you won't want to leave.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a lovely selection with fresh eggs cooked to your liking and a coffee machine available with pastries 24/7.
reviews.title: Simpatico says Robert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great pampered home away from home. Staff made sure we had the best BA experience - including finding us a great affordable Tango show and guide and tickets to a Bocca Juniors game (unforgettable in so many ways). We spent 5 days and will be back for more. Backyard oasis nice after long day of sight seeing. Stay here.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.text: The Duque Hotel Boutique and Spa is a gem of a place! Fernando and his entire staff go above and beyond expectations to make your stay pleasant, safe, and enjoyable! Our rooms were well appointed, immaculately clean, and comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was terrific with a variety of choices. This beautiful property is in Palermo Soho and is a safe location and within walking distance to wonderful restaurants and shopping. It is also close to the subway. There is a sparkling pool with lovely outdoor seating as well as a spa with jacuzzi available to guests in addition to spa services upon request. The interior design of the hotel is tastefully appointed and guests feel welcome as if a member of the Duque Family! Great value, impeccable service, impressive hotel, incredible staff! Thank you for a wonderful experience! We highly recommend the Duque Hotel Boutique and Spa!!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in BA!!

reviews.text: We just loved our stay at Duque. The hotel is beautiful. It’s has a modern yet comfortable feel to it. I love the way it’s decorated. The rooms are spacious and clean. The entire hotel (which isn’t huge-- another reason why I liked it so much) was clean. It smelled like one big dryer sheet. The breakfast is delicious. They serve fruit, homemade pastries, ham & cheeses, and they’ll make eggs to your liking. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. They gave great restaurant and tango show recommendations. It’s also located in a great location (Palermo Soho). I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent one week in Buenos Aires staying at Duque Hotel Boutique & Spa. We researched where to stay in Buenos Aires very thoroughly, and our choice of Duque Hotel Boutique & Spa was the perfect choice.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in Buenos Aires

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a beautiful property, with lovely, charming rooms, and is perfectly located in Palermo Soho - in close walking distance to great restaurants and unique, trendy, upscale shopping (my wife loved it).
reviews.title: Wish we'd had more time...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this outstanding hotel for five days in July and beyond any doubt we could not have made a better choice. The hotel has got character, comfort, outstanding service and is in the best part of Buenos Aires.
reviews.title: The place to stay in B.A.

reviews.text: I always believe that location has to be a major priority when staying in a large city. A safe neighbourhood with plenty of action and restaurants is often hard to find, yet Palermo fits this bill. The metro is nearby and there is plenty of originality and character. Don't consider staying in downtown BA, it's nothing great at night.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Duque hotel provides a great breakfast, coffee all day long and free computer access to those of us who don't take their laptops/ipads with them on holiday. The front dask is cheerful and helpful and the spa simply wonderful. All the other positive reviews say it all. This is the best address in town. So much better than those chain hotels and pretty reasonable prices too. Stay here, you will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel
Exactly Boutique!!!
reviews.text: The hotel was awesome. Pool in the back, quiet place, breakfast included, and awesome desk people who helped us figure out some of our itinerary and made recommendations. They stored our luggage when our flight didn't leave for a few hours after check out. I would definiately go back!

My wife and I recently stayed at the Duque Hotel for 5 nights in July. We found it on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed after reading all of the positive reviews. This is a small hotel, and we really felt that we got to know the staff and other guests. The service is top-notch. The employees at the front desk gave us recommendations for things to do, including a tango show that turned out to be a great experience.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed for four nights at this excellent hotel. The rooms are large and comfortable, the breakfast was the best we had in Argentina, including a choice of cooked eggs any style, and the staff are exceptionally friendly, cheerful and helpful. All of the staff we met had excellent English. One comment - alcohol purchased from the hotel is quite expensive (relative to supermarkets, cafes and restaurants). Overall though, the hotel provides fantastic value-for-money.
reviews.title: First class service at a three star price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Duque Hotel for a few days in May 2012. The staff were very courteous helpful. They provided us with recommendations for restaurants, sightseeing, and tango shows. The breakfast includes fresh eggs any style and a wide variety of accompaniments. The hotel is a tastefully remodeled building on a quiet street. The room we stayed in was very clean and well finished with everything we needed. Small things such as accent lighting, tasteful décor, use of hotel bicycles, and overall comfort make this hotel an excellent place to stay.
reviews.title: Feels Like Home

reviews.text: This is a great boutique hotel where the staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are quaint and clean, and the beds are comfortable. The subway/subte stop is a few blocks away, although this hotel is an easy walk to many of the restaurants, shops, bars and clubs that Palermo has to offer. They have a simple yet filling breakfast, with fresh fruit, pastries, toast, and eggs made to order. Trying to fit in with the BA lifestyle with late dinners and even later nights out, we liked the access to the 24 hour help-yourself espresso/coffee machine. We would definitely stay here again, and hopefully be able to enjoy some of the spa services next time.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel
Slightly disappointed
reviews.text: We were on the second leg of our BA trip and were looking forward to our stay and something nice after being in iguazu and a more simple hotel. Hotel location is excellent, service excellent, very clean, decent breakfast, great style, coffee and cakes available all day, free wifi. The disappointments were that the classic room was tiny, too small for two people, with no real window, well there were windows covered in material and when you opened them you were looking into another internal part of the hotel. Air con rattled which was annoying in the night. Pool areas shaded. We asked if we could change our room but whilst helpful they were fully booked, we had paid up front so we couldn't move hotels. We still enjoyed our stay but we wouldnt return out of chouce. If you want to go to a ranch we recommend the Los hermanos ranch over the hotels recommended option.

I just echo what pretty much every other review has said. The staff are absolutely top notch - friendly, informative and nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are comfortable and cleanliness is immaculate. The only slight negative is that my room was a little noisy as people moved around in corridors and room next door - but it was 09.30, so I should have been up and exploring the city!
reviews.title: Superb hotel

description: Duque Hotel offers rooms with designer décor and free Wi-Fi in trendy Palermo Soho. A pool and spa facilities are available. Scalabrini Ortiz Metro Station is 700 metres away.Individually designed and combining classy style with modern facilities, rooms at Duque Hotel Boutique & Spa feature parquet floors and large windows. All of them have air conditioning and cable TV.A buffet breakfast is served daily. Coffee service and pastries are available around the clock. Palermo’s restaurant and pubs are just around the corner. BBQ facilities are available.Guest can unwind on the sun loungers by the pool and make use of the spa facilities, including a jacuzzi, a sauna and Turkish baths. Massage sessions can be requested, a library is available and bikes can be rented to explore the city.The 24-hours can secure airport shuttles. Duque Hotel Boutique & Spa is 6 km from Jorge Newbery Domestic airport and 29.7 km from Ezeiza International Airport.
